thread.title: FAU Who's Hoo - Jamison's D-Line Passion
thread.title_full: FAU Who's Hoo - Jamison's D-Line Passion

title: FAU Who's Hoo - Jamison's D-Line Passion
text:
FAU Who's Hoo - Jamison's D-Line Passion 
By John Evenson/CBS12BOCA RATON, Fla. (CBS12) - Florida Atlantic Defensive Line coach Terrance Jamison played football at Wisconson for two years before a career ending injury. He almost immediately joined the Badgers coaching staff, working with the defense and current Owls head coach Charlie Partridge.And there's a good reason why Partridge has brought him to Boca Raton.When you watch Terrance Jamison coach ...you can't miss the intensity. But he was another word for it."Passionate," says Jamison. "Where does that passion come from? Just belief this is what I belief in what I'm instilling into these young men.""Up tempo, you know he just gets us going," says Ray Allen, FAU Defensive Lineman. "How he's passionate just keeps us striving to get better every play ..we just want to get better every single week."Those are exactly the traits that Coach Partridge saw in Jamison when they coached such talent as current NFL Defensive End J.J. Watt back at Wisconsin."What I've learned from Coach Partridge is you have to have a vision," says Jamison. "And you've got to have a straight forward plan to accomplish that vision that goal, pay attention to the details and I can accomplish any goal I set for myself and family myself and my players."The D-Line has been one of the strong points for the Owls this season - not so much for the Miami Dolphins. And that's something coach Jamison has been able to access having had first hand experience doing an internship with the Dolphins during the summer."Just seeing the way they learn and how they take adjustments on the field and how they respond to coaching and to see the difference in the approach of the coaches at a professional level.""He picked up from the best of the best, says Defensive End Trey Hendrickson. "Like the guys that we look up to. He can take pointers from them too and give us tips from them."And tips on how to stop their next opponent Marshall, this Saturday at noon. FAU Who's Hoo - Jamison's D-Line Passion 
Friday, October 16 2015, 12:06 AM
